main event: A series of UFO sightings reported by military personnel and civilians in Fairfield, Ohio and Bellingham, Washington in July and October 1949.
interesting points: A white, incandescent object was observed flying a straight course and then fading into the distance in Fairfield, Ohio, resembling a snow owl or sting ray fish without a tail.
In Bellingham, Washington, an object with a red-orange color was observed, seemingly stationary in the sky, before disappearing by decreasing in size.
Observations were made by credible witnesses, including a military officer and a civilian with flying experience.
One report mentioned the appearance and intermittent visibility of the planet Jupiter which may have contributed to the sightings.
The weather conditions and celestial events were extensively investigated to determine potential natural explanations for the observed phenomena.
sighted object: Unidentified flying objects with varying shapes and colors, exhibiting stationary and straight flight maneuvers before disappearing from view.
photographs: No, the report does not include any photographs
